sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | सन्न्यासस्य महाबाहो तत्त्वमिच्छामि वेदितुम् | त्यागस्य च हृषीकेश पृथक्केशिनिषूदन ||1||
transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
sannyāsasya mahā-bāho tattvam ichchhāmi veditum
tyāgasya cha hṛiṣhīkeśha pṛithak keśhi-niṣhūdana
translation: Arjuna said: O mighty-armed Krishna, I wish to understand the nature of sannyāsa (renunciation of actions) and tyāga (renunciation of the fruits of actions), and the difference between them, O Hrishikesha.

sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | काम्यानां कर्मणां न्यासं सन्न्यासं कवयो विदुः | सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं प्राहुस्त्यागं विचक्षणाः ||2||
transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
kāmyānāṁ karmaṇāṁ nyāsaṁ sannyāsaṁ kavayo viduḥ
sarva-karma-phala-tyāgaṁ prāhus tyāgaṁ vichakṣhaṇāḥ
translation: The Blessed Lord said: Giving up activities driven by desire is what the wise call sannyāsa. Renouncing the fruits of all actions is what the learned call tyāga.

sanskrit: त्याज्यं दोषवदित्येके कर्म प्राहुर्मनीषिणः | यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यमिति चापरे ||3||
transliteration:
tyājyaṁ doṣha-vad ity eke karma prāhur manīṣhiṇaḥ
yajña-dāna-tapaḥ-karma na tyājyam iti chāpare
translation: Some sages declare that all action should be abandoned as evil, while others say that acts of sacrifice, charity, and penance should never be given up.

sanskrit: निश्चयं शृणु मे तत्र त्यागे भरतसत्तम | त्यागो हि पुरुषव्याघ्र त्रिविधः सम्प्रकीर्तितः ||4||
transliteration:
niśhchayaṁ śhṛiṇu me tatra tyāge bharata-sattama
tyāgo hi puruṣha-vyāghra tri-vidhaḥ samprakīrtitaḥ
translation: Hear from Me the conclusion about renunciation, O best of the Bharatas. Renunciation is declared to be of three kinds, O tiger among men.

sanskrit: यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यं कार्यमेव तत् | यज्ञो दानं तपश्चैव पावनानि मनीषिणाम् ||5||
transliteration:
yajña-dāna-tapaḥ-karma na tyājyaṁ kāryam eva tat
yajño dānaṁ tapaśh chaiva pāvanāni manīṣhiṇām
translation: Acts of sacrifice, charity, and penance should not be abandoned; they must be performed. Indeed, they purify even the wise.

sanskrit: एतान्यपि तु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलानि च | कर्तव्यानीति मे पार्थ निश्चितं मतमुत्तमम् ||6||
transliteration:
etāny api tu karmāṇi saṅgaṁ tyaktvā phalāni cha
kartavyānīti me pārtha niśhchitaṁ matam uttamam
translation: Even these actions should be performed without attachment and desire for results. This, O Partha, is My firm and best opinion.

sanskrit: नियतस्य तु सन्न्यासः कर्मणो नोपपद्यते | मोहात्तस्य परित्यागस्तामसः परिकीर्तितः ||7||
transliteration:
niyatasya tu sannyāsaḥ karmaṇo nopapadyate
mohāt tasya parityāgas tāmasaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translation: Renunciation of prescribed duties is not proper. Abandoning them out of delusion is declared to be in the mode of ignorance.

sanskrit: दुःखमित्येव यत्कर्म कायक्लेशभयात्त्यजेत् | स कृत्वा राजसं त्यागं नैव त्यागफलं लभेत् ||8||
transliteration:
duḥkham ity eva yat karma kāya-kleśha-bhayāt tyajet
sa kṛitvā rājasaṁ tyāgaṁ naiva tyāga-phalaṁ labhet
translation: He who abandons action because it is troublesome or out of fear of bodily discomfort performs renunciation in the mode of passion and does not gain the fruit of renunciation.

sanskrit: कार्यमित्येव यत्कर्म नियतं क्रियतेऽर्जुन | सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलं चैव स त्यागः सात्त्विको मतः ||9||
transliteration:
kāryam ity eva yat karma niyataṁ kriyate ’rjuna
saṅgaṁ tyaktvā phalaṁ chaiva sa tyāgaḥ sāttviko mataḥ
translation: When one performs prescribed duty simply because it ought to be done, abandoning attachment and desire for results, that renunciation is considered to be in the mode of goodness.

sanskrit: न द्वेष्ट्यकुशलं कर्म कुशले नानुषज्जते | त्यागी सत्त्वसमाविष्टो मेधावी छिन्नसंशयः ||10||
transliteration:
na dveṣhṭy akuśhalaṁ karma kuśhale nānuṣajjate
tyāgī sattva-samāviṣhṭo medhāvī chhinna-sanśhayaḥ
translation: The intelligent renouncer, situated in goodness, neither hates unpleasant work nor is attached to pleasant work. He is free from all doubts.

sanskrit: न हि देहभृता शक्यं त्यक्तुं कर्माण्यशेषतः | यस्तु कर्मफलत्यागी स त्यागीत्यभिधीयते ||11||
transliteration:
na hi deha-bhṛitā śhakyaṁ tyaktuṁ karmāṇy aśheṣhataḥ
yas tu karma-phala-tyāgī sa tyāgīty abhidhīyate
translation: It is impossible for an embodied being to renounce all action. But one who renounces the fruits of action is truly called a renouncer.

sanskrit: अनिष्टमिष्टं मिश्रं च त्रिविधं कर्मणः फलम् | भवत्यत्यागिनां प्रेत्य न तु सन्न्यासिनां क्वचित् ||12||
transliteration:
aniṣhṭam iṣhṭaṁ miśhraṁ cha tri-vidhaṁ karmaṇaḥ phalam
bhavaty atyāgināṁ pretya na tu sannyāsināṁ kvachit
translation: The threefold fruit of action—desirable, undesirable, and mixed—accrues after death to those who are not renounced. But for those who renounce, there is no such result.

sanskrit: पञ्चैतानि महाबाहो कारणानि निबोध मे | साङ्ख्ये कृतान्ते प्रोक्तानि सिद्धये सर्वकर्मणाम् ||13||
transliteration:
pañchaitāni mahā-bāho kāraṇāni nibodha me
sāṅkhye kṛitānte proktāni siddhaye sarva-karmaṇām
translation: O mighty-armed Arjuna, learn from Me the five causes for the accomplishment of all actions, as declared in the Sankhya philosophy.

sanskrit: अधिष्ठानं तथा कर्ता करणं च पृथग्विधम् | विविधाश्च पृथक्चेष्टा दैवं चैवात्र पञ्चमम् ||14||
transliteration:
adhiṣhṭhānaṁ tathā kartā karaṇaṁ cha pṛithag-vidham
vividhāśh cha pṛithak cheṣhṭā daivaṁ chaivātra pañchamam
translation: The body, the doer, the various senses, the different kinds of effort, and divine will—these are the five factors of action.

sanskrit: शरीरवाङ्मनोभिर्यत्कर्म प्रारभते नरः | न्याय्यं वा विपरीतं वा पञ्चैते तस्य हेतवः ||15||
transliteration:
śharīra-vāṅ-mano-bhir yat karma prārabhate naraḥ
nyāyyaṁ vā viparītaṁ vā pañchaite tasya hetavaḥ
translation: Whatever action a person performs with body, speech, and mind—whether right or wrong—these five are its causes.

sanskrit: तत्रैवं सति कर्तारमात्मानं केवलं तु यः | पश्यत्यकृतबुद्धित्वान्न स पश्यति दुर्मतिः ||16||
transliteration:
tatraivaṁ sati kartāram ātmānaṁ kevalaṁ tu yaḥ
paśhyaty akṛita-buddhitvān na sa paśhyati durmatiḥ
translation: One who sees the self as the sole doer, due to an unrefined intellect, does not see things as they are and is of a distorted understanding.

sanskrit: यस्य नाहङ्कृतो भावो बुद्धिर्यस्य न लिप्यते | हत्वापि स इमाँल्लोकान्न हन्ति न निबध्यते ||17||
transliteration:
yasya nāhaṅkṛito bhāvo buddhir yasya na lipyate
hatvāpi sa imāṁl lokān na hanti na nibadhyate
translation: He who is free from ego and whose intellect is untainted—though he slays these people, he does not kill and is not bound.

sanskrit: ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं परिज्ञाता त्रिविधा कर्मचोदना | करणं कर्म कर्तेति त्रिविधः कर्मसङ्ग्रहः ||18||
transliteration:
jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ parijñātā tri-vidhā karma-chodanā
karaṇaṁ karma karteti tri-vidhaḥ karma-saṅgrahaḥ
translation: Knowledge, the object of knowledge, and the knower—these are the threefold impetus to action. The instrument, the act, and the doer are the threefold basis of action.

sanskrit: ज्ञानं कर्म च कर्ता च त्रिधैव गुणभेदतः | प्रोच्यते गुणसङ्ख्याने यथावच्छृणु तान्यपि ||19||
transliteration:
jñānaṁ karma cha kartā cha tridhaiva guṇa-bhedataḥ
prochyate guṇa-saṅkhyāne yathāvac chhṛiṇu tāny api
translation: Knowledge, action, and the doer are declared to be of three kinds according to the modes of nature. Hear about them as described in the science of the gunas.

sanskrit: सर्वभूतेषु येनैकं भावमव्ययमीक्षते | अविभक्तं विभक्तेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि सात्त्विकम् ||20||
transliteration:
sarva-bhūteṣhu yenaikaṁ bhāvam avyayam īkṣhate
avibhaktaṁ vibhakteṣhu taj jñānaṁ viddhi sāttvikam
translation: That knowledge by which one sees the one indestructible reality in all beings, undivided in the divided—know that to be sattvic knowledge.

sanskrit: पृथक्त्वेन तु यज्ज्ञानं नानाभावान्पृथग्विधान् | वेत्ति सर्वेषु भूतेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि राजसम् ||21||
transliteration:
pṛithaktvena tu yaj jñānaṁ nānā-bhāvān pṛithag-vidhān
vetti sarveṣhu bhūteṣhu taj jñānaṁ viddhi rājasam
translation: That knowledge which sees diversity in all beings as separate and distinct—is said to be in the mode of passion.

sanskrit: यत्तु कृत्स्नवदेकस्मिन्कार्ये सक्तमहैतुकम् | अतत्त्वार्थवदल्पं च तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ||22||
transliteration:
yat tu kṛitsna-vad ekasmin kārye saktam ahaitukam
atattvārtha-vad alpaṁ cha tat tāmasam udāhṛitam
translation: That knowledge which clings to one single effect as if it were the whole, without reason, without truth, and trivial—is declared to be tamasic.

sanskrit: नियतं सङ्गरहितमरागद्वेषतः कृतम् | अफलप्रेप्सुना कर्म यत्तत्सात्त्विकमुच्यते ||23||
transliteration:
niyataṁ saṅga-rahitam arāga-dveṣhataḥ kṛitam
aphala-prepsunā karma yat tat sāttvikam uchyate
translation: Action that is prescribed, performed without attachment, without love or hatred, and without desire for results is said to be in the mode of goodness.

sanskrit: यत्तु कामेप्सुना कर्म साहंकारेण वा पुनः | क्रियते बहुलायासं तद्राजसमुदाहृतम् ||24||
transliteration:
yat tu kāmepsunā karma sāhaṅkāreṇa vā punaḥ
kriyate bahulāyāsaṁ tad rājasam udāhṛitam
translation: Action performed with great effort by one seeking to gratify desires, or with a sense of ego, is said to be in the mode of passion.

sanskrit: अनुबन्धं क्षयं हिंसामनपेक्ष्य च पौरुषम् | मोहादारभ्यते कर्म यत्तत्तामसमुच्यते ||25||
transliteration:
anubandhaṁ kṣhayaṁ hiṁsām anapekṣhya cha pauruṣham
mohād ārabhyate karma yat tat tāmasam uchyate
translation: Action that is undertaken out of delusion, without regard for consequences, loss, injury to others, or one’s own ability, is said to be in the mode of ignorance.

sanskrit: मुक्तसङ्गोऽनहंवादी धृत्युत्साहसमन्वितः | सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योर्निर्विकारः कर्ता सात्त्विक उच्यते ||26||
transliteration:
mukta-saṅgo ’nahaṁ-vādī dhṛity-utsāha-samanvitaḥ
siddhy-asiddhyor nirvikāraḥ kartā sāttvika uchyate
translation: The doer who is free from attachment and ego, endowed with determination and enthusiasm, and unaffected by success or failure, is said to be in the mode of goodness.

sanskrit: रागी कर्मफलप्रेप्सुर्लुब्धो हिंसात्मकः अशुचिः | हर्षशोकान्वितः कर्ता राजसः परिकीर्तितः ||27||
transliteration:
rāgī karma-phala-prepsur lubdho hiṁsātmakaḥ aśhuchiḥ
harṣha-śhokānvitaḥ kartā rājasaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translation: The doer who is attached to the fruits of work, greedy, violent, impure, and moved by joy and sorrow, is said to be in the mode of passion.

sanskrit: अयुक्तः प्राकृतः स्तब्धः शठो नैष्कृतिकोऽलसः | विषादी दीर्घसूत्री च कर्ता तामस उच्यते ||28||
transliteration:
ayuktaḥ prākṛitaḥ stabdhaḥ śhaṭho naiṣkṛitiko ’lasaḥ
viṣhādī dīrgha-sūtrī cha kartā tāmasa uchyate
translation: The doer who is undisciplined, vulgar, stubborn, deceitful, malicious, lazy, despondent, and procrastinating is said to be in the mode of ignorance.

sanskrit: बुद्धेर्भेदं धृतेश्चैव गुणतस्त्रिविधं शृणु | प्रोच्यमानमशेषेण पृथक्त्वेन धनञ्जय ||29||
transliteration:
buddher bhedaṁ dhṛiteśh chaiva guṇatas tri-vidhaṁ śhṛiṇu
prochyamānam aśheṣheṇa pṛithaktvena dhanañjaya
translation: O Dhananjaya, now hear in full the threefold distinctions of intellect and determination, according to the modes of material nature, as I explain them.

sanskrit: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च कार्याकार्ये भयाभये | बन्धं मोक्षं च या वेत्ति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी ||30||
transliteration:
pravṛittiṁ cha nivṛittiṁ cha kāryākārye bhayābhaye
bandhaṁ mokṣhaṁ cha yā vetti buddhiḥ sā pārtha sāttvikī
translation: That intellect which knows the path of action and renunciation, what ought to be done and what ought not, fear and fearlessness, bondage and liberation—that intellect is sattvic, O Partha.

sanskrit: यया धर्ममधर्मं च कार्यं चाकार्यमेव च | अयथावत्प्रजानाति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ राजसी ||31||
transliteration:
yayā dharmam adharmaṁ cha kāryaṁ chākāryam eva cha
ayathāvat prajānāti buddhiḥ sā pārtha rājasī
translation: That intellect which is confused between righteousness and unrighteousness, and does not know what should or should not be done—is rajasic, O Partha.

sanskrit: अधर्मं धर्ममिति या मन्यते तमसावृता | सर्वार्थान्विपरीतांश्च बुद्धिः सा पार्थ तामसी ||32||
transliteration:
adharmaṁ dharmam iti yā manyate tamasāvṛitā
sarvārthān viparītāṁśh cha buddhiḥ sā pārtha tāmasī
translation: That intellect which, enveloped in darkness, considers unrighteousness to be righteousness and sees everything in a perverted way—is tamasic, O Partha.

sanskrit: धृत्या यया धारयते मनःप्राणेन्द्रियक्रियाः | योगेनाव्यभिचारिण्या धृतिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी ||33||
transliteration:
dhṛityā yayā dhārayate manaḥ-prāṇendriya-kriyāḥ
yogenāvyabhichāriṇyā dhṛitiḥ sā pārtha sāttvikī
translation: That unwavering determination which sustains the activities of the mind, life-force, and senses through the practice of yoga—is sattvic, O Partha.

sanskrit: यया तु धर्मकामार्थान्धृत्या धारयतेऽर्जुन | प्रसङ्गेन फलाकाङ्क्षी धृतिः सा पार्थ राजसी ||34||
transliteration:
yayā tu dharma-kāmārthān dhṛityā dhārayate ’rjuna
prasaṅgena phalākāṅkṣhī dhṛitiḥ sā pārtha rājasī
translation: That determination by which one holds fast to duty, pleasure, and wealth, desiring their fruits—is rajasic, O Partha.

sanskrit: यया स्वप्नं भयं शोकं विषादं मदमेव च | न विमुञ्चति दुर्मेधा धृतिः सा पार्थ तामसी ||35||
transliteration:
yayā svapnaṁ bhayaṁ śhokaṁ viṣhādaṁ madam eva cha
na vimuñchati durmedhā dhṛitiḥ sā pārtha tāmasī
translation: That determination which clings to sleep, fear, grief, depression, and arrogance, without reason—is tamasic, O Partha.

sanskrit: सुखं त्विदानीं त्रिविधं शृणु मे भरतर्षभ | अभ्यासाद्रमते यत्र दुःखान्तं च निगच्छति ||36||
transliteration:
sukhaṁ tv idānīṁ tri-vidhaṁ śhṛiṇu me bharatarṣhabha
abhyāsād ramate yatra duḥkhāntaṁ cha nigachchhati
translation: Now hear from Me, O best of the Bharatas, the three kinds of happiness. That in which one delights through practice and which ends sorrow...

sanskrit: यत्तदग्रे विषमिव परिणामेऽमृतोपमम् | तत्सुखं सात्त्विकं प्रोक्तमात्मबुद्धिप्रसादजम् ||37||
transliteration:
yat tad agre viṣham iva pariṇāme ’mṛitopamam
tat sukhaṁ sāttvikaṁ proktam ātma-buddhi-prasāda-jam
translation: That which seems like poison in the beginning but is like nectar in the end—born of the clarity of self-knowledge—is said to be sattvic happiness.

sanskrit: विषयेन्द्रियसंयोगात्यत्तदग्रेऽमृतोपमम् | परिणामे विषमिव तत्सुखं राजसं स्मृतम् ||38||
transliteration:
viṣhayendriya-saṁyogāt yat tad agre ’mṛitopamam
pariṇāme viṣham iva tat sukhaṁ rājasaṁ smṛitam
translation: That happiness which arises from contact between senses and objects, appears like nectar at first but is poison in the end—is rajasic.

sanskrit: यदग्रे चानुबन्धे च सुखं मोहनमात्मनः | निद्रालस्यप्रमादोत्थं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ||39||
transliteration:
yad agre chānubandhe cha sukhaṁ mohanam ātmanaḥ
nidrālasya-pramādotthaṁ tat tāmasam udāhṛitam
translation: That happiness which deludes the soul in the beginning and the end, arising from sleep, laziness, and negligence—is tamasic.

sanskrit: न तदस्ति पृथिव्यां वा दिवि देवेषु वा पुनः | सत्त्वं प्रकृतिजैर्मुक्तं यदेभिः स्यात्त्रिभिर्गुणैः ||40||
transliteration:
na tad asti pṛithivyāṁ vā divi deveṣhu vā punaḥ
sattvaṁ prakṛiti-jair muktaṁ yad ebhiḥ syāt tribhir guṇaiḥ
translation: There is no being on earth or even among the gods in the higher celestial realms that is free from the influence of the three modes of material nature.

sanskrit: ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियविशां शूद्राणां च परन्तप | कर्माणि प्रविभक्तानि स्वभावप्रभवैर्गुणैः ||41||
transliteration:
brāhmaṇa-kṣhatriya-viśhāṁ śhūdrāṇāṁ cha parantapa
karmāṇi pravibhaktāni svabhāva-prabhavair guṇaiḥ
translation: O Arjuna, the duties of the Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras are divided according to the qualities born of their own nature.

sanskrit: शमो दमस्तपः शौचं क्षान्तिरार्जवमेव च | ज्ञानं विज्ञानमास्तिक्यं ब्रह्मकर्म स्वभावजम् ||42||
transliteration:
śhamo damaḥ tapaḥ śhauchaṁ kṣhāntir ārjavam eva cha
jñānaṁ vijñānam āstikyaṁ brahma-karma svabhāva-jam
translation: Peacefulness, self-control, austerity, purity, tolerance, honesty, knowledge, wisdom, and faith in God are the natural duties of the Brahmins.

sanskrit: शौर्यं तेजो धृतिर्दाक्ष्यं युद्धे चाप्यपलायनम् | दानमीश्वरभावश्च क्षात्रं कर्म स्वभावजम् ||43||
transliteration:
śhauryaṁ tejo dhṛitir dākṣhyaṁ yuddhe chāpy apalāyanam
dānam īśhvara-bhāvaśh cha kṣhātraṁ karma svabhāva-jam
translation: Heroism, vigor, determination, resourcefulness, courage in battle, generosity, and leadership are the natural duties of the Kshatriyas.

sanskrit: कृषिगौरक्ष्यवाणिज्यं वैश्यकर्म स्वभावजम् | परिचर्यात्मकं कर्म शूद्रस्यापि स्वभावजम् ||44||
transliteration:
kṛiṣhi-gau-rakṣhya-vāṇijyaṁ vaiśhya-karma svabhāva-jam
paricharyātmakaṁ karma śhūdrasyāpi svabhāva-jam
translation: Farming, cow protection, and trade are the natural duties of the Vaishyas. Serving others is the natural duty of the Shudras.

sanskrit: स्वे स्वे कर्मण्यभिरतः संसिद्धिं लभते नरः | स्वकर्मनिरतः सिद्धिं यथा विन्दति तच्छृणु ||45||
transliteration:
sve sve karmaṇy abhirataḥ saṁsiddhiṁ labhate naraḥ
sva-karma-nirataḥ siddhiṁ yathā vindati tach chhṛiṇu
translation: By performing one’s own duties, every person can attain perfection. Now hear how one can achieve perfection by being engaged in their own work.

sanskrit: यतः प्रवृत्तिर्भूतानां येन सर्वमिदं ततम् | स्वकर्मणा तमभ्यर्च्य सिद्धिं विन्दति मानवः ||46||
transliteration:
yataḥ pravṛittir bhūtānāṁ yena sarvam idaṁ tatam
sva-karmaṇā tam abhyarchya siddhiṁ vindati mānavaḥ
translation: By worshiping the Supreme Being, from whom all beings originate and by whom the universe is pervaded, one can attain perfection through performance of their own duty.

sanskrit: श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् | स्वभावनियतं कर्म कुर्वन्नाप्नोति किल्बिषम् ||47||
transliteration:
śhreyān sva-dharmo viguṇaḥ para-dharmāt sv-anuṣhṭhitāt
svabhāva-niyataṁ karma kurvan nāpnoti kilbiṣham
translation: It is better to perform one’s own duties imperfectly than to master the duties of another. By fulfilling one’s natural duties, one does not incur sin.

sanskrit: सहजं कर्म कौन्तेय सदोषमपि न त्यजेत् | सर्वारम्भा हि दोषेण धूमेनाग्निरिवावृताः ||48||
transliteration:
sahajaṁ karma kaunteya sa-doṣham api na tyajet
sarvārambhā hi doṣeṇa dhūmenaāgnir ivāvṛitāḥ
translation: One should not abandon their natural duties, even if they seem imperfect, O Kaunteya. All endeavors are clouded by some fault, just as fire is covered by smoke.

sanskrit: असक्तबुद्धिः सर्वत्र जितात्मा विगतस्पृहः | नैष्कर्म्यसिद्धिं परमां सन्न्यासेनाधिगच्छति ||49||
transliteration:
asakta-buddhiḥ sarvatra jitātmā vigata-spṛihaḥ
naiṣkarmya-siddhiṁ paramāṁ sannyāsenādhigachchhati
translation: One who is detached, self-controlled, and free from desires attains the supreme perfection of freedom from action through renunciation.

sanskrit: सिद्धिं प्राप्तो यथा ब्रह्म तथाप्नोति निबोध मे | समासेनैव कौन्तेय निष्ठा ज्ञानस्य या परा ||50||
transliteration:
siddhiṁ prāpto yathā brahma tathāpnoti nibodha me
samāsenaiva kaunteya niṣhṭhā jñānasya yā parā
translation: Learn from Me briefly, O Kaunteya, how one who has attained perfection reaches the Supreme Brahman, the highest state of knowledge.

sanskrit: बुद्ध्या विशुद्धया युक्तो धृत्यात्मानं नियम्य च | शब्दादीन्विषयांस्त्यक्त्वा रागद्वेषौ व्युदस्य च ||51||
transliteration:
buddhyā viśhuddhayā yukto dhṛityātmānaṁ niyamya cha
śhabdādīn viṣhayāns tyaktvā rāga-dveṣhau vyudasya cha
translation: Endowed with a purified intellect, controlling the mind with determination, giving up sense objects like sound, and casting off attachment and aversion...

sanskrit: विविक्तसेवी लघ्वाशी यतवाक्कायमानसः | ध्यानयोगपरो नित्यं वैराग्यं समुपाश्रितः ||52||
transliteration:
vivikta-sevī laghv-āśhī yata-vāk-kāya-mānasaḥ
dhyāna-yoga-paro nityaṁ vairāgyaṁ samupāśhritaḥ
translation: Living in solitude, eating lightly, controlling speech, body, and mind, constantly engaged in meditation and dispassion...

sanskrit: अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं परिग्रहम् | विमुच्य निर्ममः शान्तो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ||53||
transliteration:
ahaṅkāraṁ balaṁ darpaṁ kāmaṁ krodhaṁ parigraham
vimuchya nirmamaḥ śhānto brahma-bhūyāya kalpate
translation: Abandoning ego, violence, pride, desire, anger, and possessiveness, becoming free from the notion of ownership and peaceful—such a person becomes fit for union with Brahman.

sanskrit: ब्रह्मभूतः प्रसन्नात्मा न शोचति न काङ्क्षति | समः सर्वेषु भूतेषु मद्भक्तिं लभते पराम् ||54||
transliteration:
brahma-bhūtaḥ prasannātmā na śhochati na kāṅkṣhati
samaḥ sarveṣhu bhūteṣhu mad-bhaktiṁ labhate parām
translation: One who is united with Brahman becomes joyful, does not grieve or desire, and is equal to all beings. Such a person attains supreme devotion to Me.

sanskrit: भक्त्या मामभिजानाति यावान्यश्चास्मि तत्त्वतः | ततो मां तत्त्वतो ज्ञात्वा विशते तदनन्तरम् ||55||
transliteration:
bhaktyā mām abhijānāti yāvān yaśh chāsmi tattvataḥ
tato māṁ tattvato jñātvā viśhate tad-anantaram
translation: Through devotion, one truly understands who I am in essence. Having known Me thus, one enters into My divine being.

sanskrit: सर्वकर्माण्यपि सदा कुर्वाणो मद्व्यपाश्रयः | मत्प्रसादादवाप्नोति शाश्वतं पदमव्ययम् ||56||
transliteration:
sarva-karmāṇy api sadā kurvāṇo mad-vyapāśhrayaḥ
mat-prasādād avāpnoti śhāśhvataṁ padam avyayam
translation: Even while performing all actions, one who takes refuge in Me attains the eternal and imperishable abode by My grace.

sanskrit: चेतसा सर्वकर्माणि मयि सन्न्यस्य मत्परः | बुद्धियोगमुपाश्रित्य मच्चित्तः सततं भव ||57||
transliteration:
chetasā sarva-karmāṇi mayi sannyasya mat-paraḥ
buddhi-yogam upāśhritya mach-chittaḥ satataṁ bhava
translation: Mentally renounce all actions to Me, be devoted to Me, and take shelter in the yoga of intellect. Always fix your mind on Me.

sanskrit: मच्चित्तः सर्वदुर्गाणि मत्प्रसादात्तरिष्यसि | अथ चेत्त्वमहङ्कारान्न श्रोष्यसि विनङ्क्ष्यसि ||58||
transliteration:
mach-chittaḥ sarva-durgāṇi mat-prasādāt tariṣhyasi
atha chet tvam ahaṅkārān na śhroṣhyasi vinaṅkṣhyasi
translation: Fix your mind on Me, and by My grace you will overcome all obstacles. But if, due to ego, you do not listen, you will perish.

sanskrit: यदहङ्कारमाश्रित्य न योत्स्य इति मन्यसे | मिथ्यैष व्यवसायस्ते प्रकृतिस्त्वां नियोक्ष्यति ||59||
transliteration:
yad ahaṅkāram āśhritya na yotsya iti manyase
mithyaiṣha vyavasāyas te prakṛitis tvāṁ niyokṣhyati
translation: If you think, out of ego, 'I will not fight,' your resolve is in vain. Your own nature will compel you to act.

sanskrit: स्वभावजेन कौन्तेय निबद्धः स्वेन कर्मणा | कर्तुं नेच्छसि यन्मोहात्करिष्यस्यवशोऽपि तत् ||60||
transliteration:
svabhāva-jena kaunteya nibaddhaḥ svena karmaṇā
kartuṁ nechchhasi yan mohāt kariṣhyasy avaśho ’pi tat
translation: O Kaunteya, bound by your own nature-born karma, even if you do not wish to act out of delusion, you will be forced to act helplessly.

sanskrit: ईश्वरः सर्वभूतानां हृद्देशेऽर्जुन तिष्ठति | भ्रामयन्सर्वभूतानि यन्त्रारूढानि मायया ||61||
transliteration:
īśhvaraḥ sarva-bhūtānāṁ hṛid-deśhe ’rjuna tiṣhṭhati
bhrāmayan sarva-bhūtāni yantrārūḍhāni māyayā
translation: The Supreme Lord dwells in the hearts of all beings, O Arjuna, and directs their wanderings through His divine power, as if they were mounted on a machine.

sanskrit: तमेव शरणं गच्छ सर्वभावेन भारत | तत्प्रसादात्परां शान्तिं स्थानं प्राप्स्यसि शाश्वतम् ||62||
transliteration:
tam eva śharaṇaṁ gachchha sarva-bhāvena bhārata
tat-prasādāt parāṁ śhāntiṁ sthānaṁ prāpsyasi śhāśhvatam
translation: Surrender exclusively unto Him with your whole being, O Bharata. By His grace, you will attain perfect peace and the eternal abode.

sanskrit: इति ते ज्ञानमाख्यातं गुह्याद्गुह्यतरं मया | विमृश्यैतदशेषेण यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु ||63||
transliteration:
iti te jñānam ākhyātaṁ guhyād guhyataraṁ mayā
vimṛiśhyaitad aśheṣheṇa yathechchhasi tathā kuru
translation: Thus, I have explained to you this knowledge that is more secret than all secrets. Reflect on it deeply, and then do as you wish.

sanskrit: सर्वगुह्यतमं भूयः शृणु मे परमं वचः | इष्टोऽसि मे दृढमिति ततो वक्ष्यामि ते हितम् ||64||
transliteration:
sarva-guhyatamaṁ bhūyaḥ śhṛiṇu me paramaṁ vachaḥ
iṣhṭo ’si me dṛiḍham iti tato vakṣhyāmi te hitam
translation: Hear again My supreme instruction, the most confidential of all. You are very dear to Me, so I will speak for your benefit.

sanskrit: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु | मामेवैष्यसि सत्यं ते प्रतिजाने प्रियोऽसि मे ||65||
transliteration:
man-manā bhava mad-bhakto mad-yājī māṁ namaskuru
mām evaiṣhyasi satyaṁ te pratijāne priyo ’si me
translation: Always think of Me, become My devotee, worship Me, and offer your homage to Me. Thus you will come to Me. I promise you this because you are dear to Me.

sanskrit: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज | अहं त्वां सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः ||66||
transliteration:
sarva-dharmān parityajya mām ekaṁ śharaṇaṁ vraja
ahaṁ tvāṁ sarva-pāpebhyo mokṣhayiṣhyāmi mā śhuchaḥ
translation: Abandon all varieties of dharma and simply surrender unto Me. I shall deliver you from all sinful reactions. Do not fear.

sanskrit: इदं ते नातपस्काय नाभक्ताय कदाचन | न चाशुश्रूषवे वाच्यं न च मां योऽभ्यसूयति ||67||
transliteration:
idaṁ te nātapaskāya nābhaktāya kadāchana
na chāśhuśhrūṣhave vācyaṁ na cha māṁ yo ’bhyasūyati
translation: This should never be spoken to one who is not austere, not devoted, not willing to listen, or who is envious of Me.

sanskrit: य इमं परमं गुह्यं मद्भक्तेष्वभिधास्यति | भक्तिं मयि परां कृत्वा मामेवैष्यत्यसंशयः ||68||
transliteration:
ya imaṁ paramaṁ guhyaṁ mad-bhakteṣhv abhidhāsyati
bhaktiṁ mayi parāṁ kṛitvā mām evaiṣhyaty asaṁśhayaḥ
translation: One who teaches this supreme secret to My devotees, showing the highest devotion to Me, will undoubtedly come to Me.

sanskrit: न च तस्मान्मनुष्येषु कश्चिन्मे प्रियकृत्तमः | भविता न च मे तस्मादन्यः प्रियतमः भुवि ||69||
transliteration:
na cha tasmān manuṣhyeṣhu kaśhchin me priya-kṛittamaḥ
bhavitā na cha me tasmād anyaḥ priya-tamaḥ bhuvi
translation: There is no one among men more dear to Me than he who shares this knowledge, nor will there ever be anyone more dear.

sanskrit: अध्येष्यते च य इमं धर्म्यं संवादमावयोः | ज्ञानयज्ञेन तेनाहमिष्टः स्यामिति मे मतिः ||70||
transliteration:
adhyeṣhyate cha ya imaṁ dharmyaṁ saṁvādam āvayoḥ
jñāna-yajñena tenāham iṣhṭaḥ syām iti me matiḥ
translation: One who studies this sacred dialogue of ours worships Me through the sacrifice of knowledge. This is My opinion.

sanskrit: श्रद्धावाननसूयश्च शृणुयादपि यो नरः | सोऽपि मुक्तः शुभाँल्लोकान्प्राप्नुयात्पुण्यकर्मणाम् ||71||
transliteration:
śhraddhāvān anasūyaśh cha śhṛiṇuyād api yo naraḥ
so ’pi muktaḥ śhubhān lokān prāpnuyāt puṇya-karmaṇām
translation: Even one who listens to this with faith and without envy becomes free and attains the auspicious realms of the virtuous.

sanskrit: कच्चिदेतच्छ्रुतं पार्थ त्वयैकाग्रेण चेतसा | कच्चिदज्ञानसंमोहः प्रनष्टस्ते धनञ्जय ||72||
transliteration:
kachchid etach chhrutaṁ pārtha tvayaikāgreṇa chetasā
kachchid ajñāna-sammohaḥ pranaṣhṭas te dhanañjaya
translation: O Partha, have you heard this with a focused mind? Has your ignorance and delusion been destroyed, O Dhananjaya?

sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | नष्टो मोहः स्मृतिर्लब्धा त्वत्प्रसादान्मयाच्युत | स्थितोऽस्मि गतसन्देहः करिष्ये वचनं तव ||73||
transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
naṣṭo mohaḥ smṛitir labdhā tvat-prasādān mayāchyuta
sthito ’smi gata-sandehaḥ kariṣye vachanaṁ tava
translation: Arjuna said: O Infallible One, my delusion is destroyed and I have regained my memory through Your grace. I am now firm and free from doubt and will act according to Your word.

sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच | इत्यहं वासुदेवस्य पार्थस्य च महात्मनः | संवादमिममश्रौषमद्भुतं रोमहर्षणम् ||74||
transliteration:
sañjaya uvācha
ity ahaṁ vāsudevasya pārthasya cha mahātmanaḥ
saṁvādam imam aśhrauṣham adbhutaṁ roma-harṣhaṇam
translation: Sanjaya said: Thus I heard this wonderful dialogue between Krishna and the high-souled Arjuna, which causes my hair to stand on end.

sanskrit: व्यासप्रसादाच्छ्रुतवानेतद्गुह्यमहं परम् | योगं योगेश्वरात्कृष्णात्साक्षात्कथयतः स्वयम् ||75||
transliteration:
vyāsa-prasādāch chhrutavān etad guhyam ahaṁ param
yogaṁ yogeśhvarāt kṛiṣhṇāt sākṣhāt kathayataḥ svayam
translation: By the grace of Vyasa, I have heard this supreme and most secret yoga directly from Krishna, the Lord of Yoga, who spoke it Himself.

sanskrit: राजन्संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य संवादमिममद्भुतम् | केशवार्जुनयोः पुण्यं हृष्यामि च मुहुर्मुहुः ||76||
transliteration:
rājan saṁsmṛitya saṁsmṛitya saṁvādam imam adbhutam
keśhavārjunayoḥ puṇyaṁ hṛiṣhyāmi cha muhur muhuḥ
translation: O King, remembering again and again this holy and wonderful dialogue between Krishna and Arjuna, I rejoice again and again.

sanskrit: तच्च संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य रूपमत्यद्भुतं हरेः | विस्मयो मे महान् राजन्हृष्यामि च पुनः पुनः ||77||
transliteration:
tach cha saṁsmṛitya saṁsmṛitya rūpam aty-adbhutaṁ hareḥ
vismayo me mahān rājan hṛiṣhyāmi cha punaḥ punaḥ
translation: And remembering again and again the most wondrous form of Hari, great is my amazement, O King, and I rejoice again and again.

sanskrit: यत्र योगेश्वरः कृष्णो यत्र पार्थो धनुर्धरः | तत्र श्रीर्विजयो भूतिर्ध्रुवा नीतिर्मतिर्मम ||78||
transliteration:
yatra yogeśhvaraḥ kṛiṣhṇo yatra pārtho dhanur-dharaḥ
tatra śhrīr vijayo bhūtir dhruvā nītir matir mama
translation: Wherever there is Krishna, the Lord of Yoga, and Arjuna, the wielder of the bow, there will surely be prosperity, victory, happiness, and righteousness. This is my firm conviction.
